Detailed Description

The header file describes the ZCL Parser interface.

The file describes the interface and types of ZCL Parser

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Definition in file zclParser.h.

Function Documentation

uint8_t zclFormRequest ( APS_DataReq_t *  dataReq,
uint8_t  reqType,
uint8_t  direction,
uint8_t  commandId,
uint8_t  defaultResponse,
uint16_t  manufacSpecCode,
uint8_t  sequenceNumber 
)

Form zcl header.

Parameters:
[in]-dataReq - pointer to data request;
[in]-reqType - type of the request;
[in]-direction - cluster side;
[in]-commandId - zcl command identification;
[in]-defaultResponse - presence or absence of the default responde;
[in]-manufacSpecCode - manufacturer specific code;
[in]-sequenceNumber - next sequence number;
Returns:
header length
void zclResponseInd ( ZclAuxParseData_t *  auxData,
ZCL_Request_t *  req 
)

Response has been received.

Parameters:
[in]auxData- pointer to structure with command payload and descriptor of received command frame.
[in]req- pointer to the request, which is the reason of the response.
void zclCommandInd ( ZclAuxParseData_t *  auxData)

Special cluster command has been received.

Parameters:
[in]auxData- pointer to structure with command payload and descriptor of received command frame.

const ZclFrameDescriptor_t *  incomingFrameInfo,
ZCL_AttributeEvent_t  event,
ZCL_AttributeId_t  attributeId 
)

The attribute has been read or written.

Parameters:
[in]apsDataInd- attribute payload
[in]incomingFrameInfo- information from the header of the incoming frame
[in]event- event type
[in]attributeId- attribute identifier
void zclConfigurationInd ( APS_DataInd_t *  apsData,
ZclFrameDescriptor_t *  frameDesc 
)

Configuration has been received.

Parameters:
[in]apsData- configuration payload
[in]frameDesc- descriptor of received report frame
void zclDataInd ( APS_DataInd_t *  ind)

Indication from CAPS.

Parameters:
[in]ind- buffer for data indication.
uint8_t zclGetSecurityTypeByClusterId ( ClusterId_t  clusterId,
Endpoint_t  endpointId,
bool  mspSupport 
)

Security Type get by Cluster Id function and by endpointId, on which was registered cluster. Returns Security Type should be used with ClusterId specified.

Parameters:
[in]clusterId- cluster identifier
[in]endpointId- end point identifier
[in]mspSupport- manufacturerSpecific bit in the header
Returns:
ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY - NWK Key Security should be used ZCL_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY - APS Link Key Security shoud be used. If cluster is unknown, security key will be determined by security mode, i.e. ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY for Standard Security, ZCL_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY for High Security.
ZCL_DeviceEndpoint_t* zclNextEndpoint ( ZCL_DeviceEndpoint_t *  prev)

Get next registered ZCL endpoint descriptor by previous.

Parameters:
[in]prev- previous ZCL endpoint descriptor pointer.It is must be non NULL sequential access required if. And it is must be NULL the first descriptor as registered endpoints queue head element access required if.
Returns:
Valid ZCL endpoint descriptor pointer descriptor found if, NULL - other case.
ZCL_DeviceEndpoint_t* zclGetEndpoint ( Endpoint_t  endpointId)

Find endpoint descriptor by endpoint id.

Parameters:
[in]endpointId- endpoint unique identifier.
Returns:
endpoint descriptor if found, NULL otherwise.
